properties.Name: Pablo y Pablo
properties.Chatter: the latest from the Heavy Restaurant Group, the people behind the Purple Cafe and Wine bars and neighborhood spots like Meet the Moon. Its latest, north of Gas Works Park, is a casual Mexican bar restaurant, though it won’t resemble the same company's popular mescal spot Barrio on Capitol Hill. A dozen different tacos, from wild boar meatballs to lamb belly "carnitas," are featured, along with Mexican comfort food with little Latin tweaks. There are beers from Honduras, Costa Rica and Guatemala. Like at Barrio, Pablo y Pablo also boasts a big agave spirits list, around 70 different mescals and tequilas. The 2,500-square-foot restaurant seats 70 inside and 30 out on the patio.

properties.Name: Tentenyu
properties.Chatter: Started in Kyoto, Japan, and expanded with two locations in California before opening on Capitol Hill in July. The owners saw a growing ramen market in the Seattle area, a spokeswoman said. Its Tentenyu Chashu ramen is supersized with 8 pork slices. There’s also a vegetarian ramen option.

properties.Name: Betsutenjin Ramen
properties.Chatter: Another new ramen spot.

properties.Name: Ba Bar
properties.Chatter: All the favorites, from spring rolls to its pho-ramen hybrid, are offered. This new Ba Bar will double as a test kitchen; expect banh mis, egg noodles and other new dishes to be launched there first before you see them at the Capitol Hill or South Lake Union branches.

properties.Name: Flying Boots & Wings @ravenna
properties.Chatter: Ravenna Alehouse is now Flying Boots & Wings @ravenna, the same folks behind the popular chicken-wing joint in Tacoma

properties.Name: Opus Co.
properties.Chatter: A wood-fire restaurant in Phinney Ridge from chef Mark Schroder, former chef de cuisine at Trove.

Arguably the most popular lunch spot on the Amazon campus now, from the folks behind 99 Park Restaurant in Bellevue. The menu is contemporary American cuisine, with seafood, lamb tartare and Wagyu beef burgers.

properties.Name: Lady Yum
properties.Chatter: Expansion of Kirkland-based macaron sweet treats on the Amazon campus.

properties.Name: Pinxto
properties.Chatter: Relocated, expect an expanded and more ambitious dinner menu now that there's a bigger kitchen to play with.

properties.Name: Wallyburger
properties.Chatter: A western themed burger-and-shake joint that's more Roy Rogers than Jesse James. Part Austin roadhouse, part saloon, is how the owners described it.

properties.Name: Ma’ono Fried Chicken
properties.Chatter: A walk-up window inside Rachel's Ginger Beer at the U Village, similar to the setup of other Rachel's bars around town. Like much of Mark Fuller's fare, the food has Hawaiian and Asian tweaks — fried chicken sandwiches are served on King’s sweet buns and topped with daikon pickles, and the mac and cheese gets spiced up with Korean chiles. The limited menu consists of just three sandwiches, two salads and four sides.

properties.Name: Terry's Kitchen
properties.Chatter: Comfort food spanning east and west, from loco moco and chow mein to burgers and pork chops. The owner is also opening a pool hall and bar next to this Newport Hills restaurant by the end of the year.

properties.Name: Triangle Spirits
properties.Chatter: Purchased by some bartenders and other industry peeps. But don't expect any major overhaul with the food-and-drink menu until next year.

properties.Name: Moon's Kitchen
properties.Chatter: Teriyaki, katsu, ramen and yakisoba, but its Instagram-friendly flower pot ice cream seems to get all the love.

properties.Name: Indi Chocolate Café & Chocolate Factory
properties.Chatter: Open in the new MarketFront building at Pike Place Market. You can watch them make chocolate behind the glass window. There's also pastries and an espresso bar.

properties.Name: Old Stove Brewing
properties.Chatter: New MarketFront building

properties.Name: Jarr & Co.
properties.Chatter: New MarketFront building

properties.Name: Honest Biscuits
properties.Chatter: New MarketFront building

properties.Name: Carnivore
properties.Chatter: Paleo food and craft cocktails with chef Seamus Platt of Mollusk and Girin heading the kitchen.

properties.Name: Tankard & Tun
properties.Chatter: Seafood retaurant from the couple behind The Pike Brewing Company.

properties.Name: Dexter Brewhouse
properties.Chatter: Mollusk brewery in South Lake Union is rebranding as Dexter Brewhouse: new pub food menu, same beer.

properties.Name: Water's Table
properties.Chatter: 236 seats and a view of Lake Washington in the Hyatt Regency in Renton. The hotel restaurant focuses on pan-Asian cuisine.

properties.Name: Bun & Oc
properties.Chatter: Escargot 10 different ways, a Vietnamese delicacy that never became mainstream. This noodle house in the Chinatown-International District is the latest to give escargot a go.

properties.Name: Lan Hue
properties.Chatter: Sandwich shop with 17 different banh mis from pate to grilled pork. The grand-opening special: buy five banh mi, get one free.

properties.Name: Coba
properties.Chatter: Another Vietnamese restaurant, focusing on pho and vermicelli noodles and for brunch, beef stew and chicken congee.

properties.Name: Falafel Salam
properties.Chatter: The popular food truck now has a brick-and-mortar in West Seattle with an expanded menu and even beer.

properties.Name: Great American Diner & Bar
properties.Chatter: A bit more ambitious than your usual greasy spoon with wild-caught coho and jambalaya on the menu.

properties.Name: King Philly Cheesesteaks
properties.Chatter: Wings and a veggie sandwich are on the menu, but it should be obvious what to order here.

properties.Name: Cheese Meats Bread
properties.Chatter: CMB, short for Cheese Meats Bread, opens inside the Uwajimaya food court, from the same owner behind 8oz Burger & Co on Capitol Hill and in Ballard. The kitchen toyed with different grilled cheese combos before settling on a five-cheese blend of Beecher’s flagship white cheddar, buffalo mozzarella, mild cheddar, fontina and muenster.

properties.Name: Great State Burger
properties.Chatter: Great State's fourth location.

properties.Name: Tacos de la Noche
properties.Chatter: The new walk-up window inside Bar Sue, the underrated whiskey bar on Capitol Hill. It hawks tacos, tortas and nachos.

properties.Name: El Taco Loco
properties.Chatter: Opens inside Ballard Liquor Store, serving $2 tacos and other Mexican fare.

properties.Name: SWeL
properties.Chatter: An eclectic menu of seafood and pizza, and like the bar it replaced, Sixgill, also has a stellar draft list.

properties.Name: BB's Teriyaki Grill
properties.Chatter: Big, cheap portions for the college crowd.

properties.Name: B-Side
properties.Chatter: From the same folks behind Analog Coffee, a short and simple breakfast-and-lunch menu (frittata to smoked trout).

properties.Name: CTO
properties.Chatter: Inside Beer Star in White Center, Li'l Woody's and CTO are both open, the latter is food inspired by Chinese-American greasy spoons.

properties.Name: Lil Woody's
properties.Chatter: Inside Beer Star in White Center, Li'l Woody's and CTO are both open, the latter is food inspired by Chinese-American greasy spoons.

properties.Name: RPM
properties.Chatter: There's pizza again in the old Pizzeria Gabbiano spot in Pioneer Square but under different ownership: RPM, short for Revolution Pizza Music.

properties.Name: Broadway Poke & Sushi
properties.Chatter: What's a new-restaurants list without another poke opening?
